alert.note: Alert for Greene; Marengo; Sumter (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 26 at 4:13AM CST until January 30 at 3:00AM CST by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Alabama... Tombigbee River At Gainesville Lock and Dam affecting Greene, Sumter and Marengo Counties. .Heavy rainfall has occurred Tombigbee River basin and a flood warning is now in effect for the Tombigbee River. The next statement will be issued this evening at 715 PM CST. && ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM SATURDAY EVENING TO EARLY TUESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Tombigbee River at Gainesville Lock and Dam. * WHEN...From Saturday evening to early Tuesday morning. * IMPACTS...At 101.0 feet, Flooding of low lying agricultural and wooded lands in the area occurs. At 109.0 feet, Flooding of some camps and cabins...as well as widespread flooding of low-lying woods and agricultural lands... occurs, especially upstream of the lock and dam. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 4:00 AM CST Friday the stage was 94.7 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage Friday morning to a crest of 103.9 feet early Saturday afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage early Monday morning. - Flood stage is 101.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
